entry.title: Customizing the Django Admin
entry.summary:
Summary

I plan on showing a live example and customizing as we go. This will be a pretty mid-level talk and should be interesting to those not familiar, those who know django and considered using the admin, and for djangonuts who want to do some pretty advanced stuff.

Description

  • Registering Models in the Admin
  • Customizing the filtering, search, general display
  • Adding Actions
  • Inlines
  • Custom Forms
  • Making Fields Readonly by inheriting
  • Integrating jQuery
  • Custom Widgets like Image thumbnails
  • Changing look and feel

entry.title: Customizing the Django Admin
entry.summary:
Description

How to build great admin user interfaces while still leveraging the power of the Django's batteries-included admin.

Abstract

The Django admin interface is a great tool for rapidly viewing and generating content, but its default one size fits all approach may not be the best for the users of it.

This talk is broken into two parts. First, we will discuss user experience and what users have come to expect from an admin tool. In the second half, we'll show you how to bend Django's admin to meet those expectations.
